programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.desc: Setting off on a journey to the west in the 1830s, the Prescott family run into a man named Linus (James Stewart), who helps them fight off a pack of thieves. Linus then marries daughter Eve Prescott (Carroll Baker), and 30 years later goes off to fight in the Civil War with their son, with bloody results. Eve's sister, Lily (Debbie Reynolds), heads further west and has adventures with a professional gambler (Gregory Peck), stretching all the way to San Francisco and into the 1880s.

programme.title: Great Day in the Morning
programme.desc: In Denver before the outbreak of the Civil War, North Carolina native Owen Pentecost (Robert Stack) tricks saloon owner Jumbo Means (Raymond Burr) into losing everything he owns -- including some valuable mining claims -- in a card game. As headstrong dressmaker Ann (Virginia Mayo) and bartender Boston (Ruth Roman) spar over Owen's affections, his fellow Southerners begin assembling their gold to fund the Confederate Army, as the town's Northerners form their own militia and prepare for war.

programme.title: War Paint

Billings (Robert Stack) and his troopers are in a race against time to avoid all-out war. Since time is of the essence, Billings recruits the chief's son, Taslik (Keith Larsen), to guide the men to the village. However, Billings and his men are unaware that a group of renegades, wary of the suspicious U.S. treaty, seek to kill the messengers before they can complete their mission.

Unfortunately, his pathological hatred of Native Americans causes him to commit rash acts that put his troops in jeopardy. The enlisted men, especially the rebellious McGurney (Forrest Tucker), question Vinson's leadership and even his morality, but the soldiers must stick together if they wish to make it through Apache lands.

programme.title: Wichita

Armed and ready for anything, the new marshal decides he will end gun violence simply by banning guns. Soon Earp must face crooked rancher Clint Wallace (Walter Sande) and whiskey slinger Doc Black (Edgar Buchanan), vicious locals who like Wichita exactly as it is and don't take kindly to being told what to do.

Ryan begins to work with the area sheriff and falls for the lawman's pretty daughter, Molly Jones (Joan Weldon). With Clark hiding in plain sight as a piano player, the criminal manages to evade Ryan for a while, but eventually the two adversaries come face-to-face.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.desc: Erskine and Colby thwart a gangland scheme to control harbors.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Inspector Erskine is endangered when he assumes an undercover role to capture platinum thieves.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Having failed his assignment, a hired killer is pursued by a criminal executioner and the FBI.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Inspector Erskine leads an FBI search for a husband-and-wife robbery team.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Clear
programme.desc: Comedian D.L. Hughley comments on current political events and hot topics, from marijuana legalization to the advantages of intrusive white neighbors.

programme.title: Tiffany Haddish: She Ready! From the Hood to Hollywood!
programme.desc: The sensational “Girls Trip” star shares about her positive outlook on life, growing up in the foster care system, and working with legends.

programme.title: Margaret Cho: Psycho
programme.desc: The comic provocateur tackles a new list of taboos—from race to sexuality to Boko Haram—in front of a live audience at New York’s Town Hall.

programme.title: Nick Thune: Folk Hero
programme.desc: Nick Thune performs live at Brooklyn's Bell Theater.

programme.title: Nick Thune: Good Guy
programme.desc: Living legend, Nick Thune, takes the stage in Portland, Oregon and explains his stunning transformation into a Good Guy. Topics in this "instant classic" range from funny to hilarious. Watch now to witness what many are calling the future of comedy.

programme.title: Christian Finnegan: The Fun Part
programme.desc: Disarmingly honest and brutally charming, Christian Finnegan discusses every aspect of life in this comedy special - from traveling the globe to inconvenient bodily functions.

programme.title: Dave Nihill: Documented
programme.desc: Originally from Dublin, Ireland, the spirited comedian discusses the lack of diversity in his audience, Irish culture, and so much more.

programme.title: Debra DiGiovanni: Single, Awkward, Female
programme.desc: The Canadian comedian known for her work as a finalist on Last Comic Standing discusses her takes on dating, dieting, and modern romance.

programme.title: Eddie Izzard: Circle
programme.desc: This show served as a pivotal career moment for Izzard, moving the stand up from relative obscurity to a successful mainstream career.

programme.title: Eddie Izzard: Definite Article
programme.desc: This hilarious special captures the stand-up performing in the Shaftesbury Theatre in London, during the comic’s legendary 12 week run.

programme.title: Erica Rhodes: I Love You More
programme.desc: The Comedy Central @midnight and Fox Punchline panelist with the high-pitched voice brings this 40-minute stand-up set to a live audience.

programme.title: Erica Rhodes: La Vie en Rhodes
programme.desc: The stand up sensation performs at the legendary Rose Bowl, discussing annoying quotes, texting etiquette, and the downfall of exes.

programme.title: Fatimah Taliah: Nice to Meet Me
programme.desc: From the stress of student loans to anxiety and getting to know herself on lockdown, here is comedian Fatimah Taliah’s breakout comedy special!

programme.title: Fred Klett: One of Ten
programme.desc: The comedian discusses growing up in a large Christian family, modern parenting, and the ridiculous nature of how today’s kids are disciplined.

programme.title: Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Fran Drescher leads a cast of mature women of stand-up in a night of uninhibited comedy; featuring Carole Montgomery, Luenell, Lynne Koplitz, Kerri Louise and Vanessa Hollingshead.

programme.title: Ginny Hogan: Regression
programme.desc: Ginny Hogan has an idea of what her life should look like by 30, and she's got a plan to get herself there.

programme.title: Gina Yashere: Laughing to America
programme.desc: Live from San Francisco, UK's top black female comedian Gina Yashere brings her unique insider-outsider perspective on America's hottest news.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding the Monsters
programme.desc: The comedian and ventriloquist extraordinaire, along with this felt friends, visits a haunted house where hilarious chaos ensues.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: The comedian and his puppets perform in the gorgeous Dolby Theatre, featuring hilarious sketches with surprise guests and lots of laughs.

programme.title: John Heffron: Middle Class Funny
programme.desc: The Michigan comedian discusses his deep frustrations in marriage, loathing for when people are passive-aggressive, and other relatable subjects.

programme.title: Josh Gondelman: People Pleaser
programme.desc: The comic who just wants everyone to have a good time explores the pressures of appearing in his friends’ dreams and choosing the right wedding DJ.

programme.title: Kevin Nealon: Whelmed, But Not Overly
programme.desc: With his unique sense of humor, profound dry wit, and likeable demeanor, Kevin Nealon brings his jazzy cool style to “Whelmed… But Not Overly.” He's like a big kid as he delights in stories of messing with celebrities and embarrassing moments.

programme.title: Joel McHale: Live From Pyongyang
programme.desc: Fan favorite Joel McHale shines in his first stand-up special with jokes on being mistaken for Daniel Tosh, feeding alligators in the South, and more.

programme.title: Michael Yo: Blasian
programme.desc: Comedian Michael Yo taps into his experience growing up black and Asian in Texas to inform his takes on marriage, fatherhood, race and religion.

programme.title: Gary Gulman: Boyish Man
programme.desc: Last Comic Standing alum, Gary Gulman, delivers with his clever wit and handsome boyish charm. Boyish Man features Hanukkah vs. Christmas, all kinds of cookies (and crackers) dating, sex… and everything in between.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 15
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 16
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Kellen Erskine: Composed
programme.desc: Featured on NBC's “America's Got Talent,” this stand-up comic has written jokes that appear in a variety of publications, including “Reader's Digest.”

programme.title: Kellen Erskine: Zoomed Out
programme.desc: In this comedy special, Kellen Erskine ponders everyday oddities, from robot vacuums to the baton-waving workers who direct planes at the airport.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Louie Anderson: Big Baby Boomer
programme.desc: Veteran funny man Louie Anderson returns to the stage in this hilarious one hour stand up comedy special. Louie takes an unconventional and jovial look at his bad habits, pesky family members, and aging body.

programme.title: Louie Anderson: Big Underwear
programme.desc: The iconic comic plays on the challenges of getting healthy, life on the road, dealing with technology and how we all eventually become our parents.

programme.title: Michael Gelbart: All New Smash Hits
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Michael Gelbart's profanity-free, yet adult set, for audiences takes on love, relationships, and where the world is now.

programme.title: Mike E. Winfield: StepMan
programme.desc: The comedian stars in his own one-man show about marrying an older woman and finding out how much he is truly similar to his younger stepson.

programme.title: Paul Rodriguez: The Here and Wow
programme.desc: Veteran comedian, Paul Rodriguez hits the stage to give his perspectives on life, from being peer pressured into believing in God to claiming to be the village idiot.

programme.title: Rhys Darby: Mystic Time Bird
programme.desc: The Flight of the Conchords star known for his silly perspectives, physicality, and sound effects, discusses mysticism, past lives, and birds.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Takin' It To D.C.
programme.desc: Whether he's talking about sex, the national anthem, cockroaches or impersonating Michael Jackson, the triple threat is sure to make you laugh.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Illin' In Philly
programme.desc: This is Tommy Davidson, from "In Living Color", at his funniest! Check out this classic stand-up special and remember the 90s!

programme.title: Whitney Cummings: Money Shot
programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Wendy Liebman: It’s Wendy
programme.desc: Wendy Liebman delivers 45 minutes of pure gold, discussing things like pen pals, the magic of tidying up your space, and her goofy dogs.

programme.title: The Carol Burnett Show

programme.desc: Sketches include: "The West Dakota County Fair", "War Is Heck", and another visit with "The Old Folks."

programme.desc: Sketches include an escaped convict seeking refuge in a diner, plus Carol and Vicki as robots.

programme.desc: Guest star Joanne Woodward spends an evening with "The Family" in this episode.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the longest day of the year approaches, there's more time to be outside and enjoy the garden and Monty is no exception. Although some vegetables do not respond well to a late sowing, there are others that do and Monty gives his tips on late croppers to sow now. Carol Klein and Joe Swift make a visit to Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham to revel in the hundreds of summer flowering plants on display and to find design tips for small gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whilst celebrating the glory of summer flowers at Longmeadow, Monty has plenty of tips, from pruning and propagation techniques for different types of clematis to troubleshooting problems with roses. Carol Klein wades through streams and marshes to show us how gardeners can emulate nature when choosing the right water plants for our gardens, and we visit Norfolk to revel in an extraordinary collection of iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is reaping the rewards of the summer when he begins to harvest crops from the vegetable garden and gives tips on extending the flower season in the borders. Carol takes a trip to the seaside to discover why some plants thrive, despite being assaulted by salt-laden winds. We make a final visit to Sissinghurst, to catch up with Troy Scott-Smith and the changes that have been made to the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer gets into full swing, there is plenty for Monty to be doing at Longmeadow. He gets to grips with summer pruning as he tackles his espaliered pear trees. Nature's bounty is very much in evidence at Lord Rothschild's garden at Waddesdon Manor, where we get an exclusive look behind the scenes. Also, Joe Swift ponders ways of putting a contemporary twist on traditional bedding plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that the rambling roses have finished flowering, Monty turns his attention to pruning and tying in new growth for a good display next year. On the 20th anniversary of the death of Geoff Hamilton, Adam Frost returns to the famous `Gardeners' World' location, Barnsdale, to pay tribute and to revisit some his own early gardening memories. Also, we travel to Abergavenny to visit the garden of a sweet pea enthusiast to get her top tips for growing the best blooms.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift pays a visit to the Northumberland garden of Chris Mullin who, after over twenty years as a Member of Parliament, has turned his attention to the renovation of his walled garden. And National Trust head gardener, Alan Power, catches up with the transformation of Shakespeare's New Place garden in Stratford-upon-Avon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team are at RHS Rosemoor in Devon to find out about their fruit trees and sedum collection, and Joe visits Scampston Hall, home of a ten-year experiment in naturalistic planting by garden designer Piet Oudolf.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests apples, pears and quince and plants indoor bulbs, we meet a Northern Irish daffodil breeder, and Carol Klein travels to Wales to explore the Eupatorium with a passionate gardener who has a rare and spectacular collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the autumn equinox and Monty celebrates the season's apple bounty. Monty also plans for Christmas when he plants bulbs to brighten dark winter days, and he gives advice on planting garlic for the following year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With summer in mind, Monty plants up a seating area filled with night-scented plants and begins preparations to sow a new lawn. He also takes dahlia cuttings and sows squash for an autumn harvest.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween approaching, Monty takes stock of his pumpkins and squashes, plants up alpines and shows how to divide a large fern to create new plants. Meanwhile, Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit Hever Castle in Kent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives tips on moving plants which are in the wrong place or have outgrown their space, shows how to store chilies and harvests the last of his tomatoes. Rachel de Thame returns to Longmeadow to talk to Monty about her return to health and to plant up pots for spring colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that birds are no longer nesting in hedges, now is the time to get them looking trim and neat and Monty has plenty of tips on how to cut them so that they grow well. Alan Power visits Croome Park in Worcestershire to discover more about one of the first great landscapes of Capability Brown and we visit a couple in Gloucestershire whose ornamental grass garden was inspired by the Far East.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the bank holiday ahead there's plenty of opportunity to catch up with some essential jobs in the garden and Monty gives a masterclass on how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill is at RHS Rosemoor where she is catching up on her vegetable trials which she started earlier in the year, and Alan Power visits Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the regular team are joined by some new faces offering tips, advice and inspiration from gardens large and small across the country. In this programme Monty is at Longmeadow catching up with some seasonal jobs, and also getting out and about for an inspiring visit to the longest herbaceous border in the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow giving advice on how to deal with unruly roses, taking cuttings of herbs and planting a new tree. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families, exploring some of the most popular relations of the rose and we pay a visit to an orchard in Worcestershire to find out how enthusiasts are caring for one of the rose family members - the plum.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: September is the perfect time for planting and Monty adds some autumn flowering asters to his borders as well as refreshing his strawberry beds with new stock. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families and this week she takes a close look at one of the largest plant families in the world, the daisy family, and we pay a visit to a plant nursery in Hampshire, which specialises in growing plants - including many varieties of daisy - for attracting wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There's plenty of advice from Longmeadow this week, as Monty starts to tidy up the garden for autumn and reviews this year's display in the jewel garden. In the final part of Carol Klein's series on plant families she looks at the Apiaceae family, which includes not only stalwart and wild-life friendly plants but also edible roots; and we pay a visit to a giant vegetable grower in Nottinghamshire who is hoping to break the world record with his carrots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, bringing viewers up to date on how it has been developing, as well as giving advice on growing hydrangeas. Toby Buckland shares his tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests apples, pears and quince and plants indoor bulbs, we meet a Northern Irish daffodil breeder, and Carol Klein travels to Wales to explore the Eupatorium with a passionate gardener who has a rare and spectacular collection.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives more advice on tomato-growing, Nick Bailey travels to South Africa in search of the cousins of the Crocosmia, and Advolly Richmond looks at the Victorian trend of garden theme parks.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well under way, some plants in the garden need to be brought in under cover. Monty Don makes a start by insulating his greenhouse to provide a winter home for all sorts of tender plants and gives his tips and techniques for ensuring their survival until next year. Carol Klein visits the garden of a tropical plant enthusiast to find out how he protects some of his exotic specimens.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Come along with Bob Ross as he creates a winter moon hanging over a snow covered farm nestled among the trees - all on black canvas.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross invites you to join him at a quaint little mountain-top home with a breathtaking view of distant snow-covered mountains.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Join television artist Bob Ross and take a peek through the fog of a snowy morning as the awakening sun enters into a new day.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Travel to the tropics with Bob Ross, stroll along the palm tree shores and drink in the soul-cleansing beauty of the sea. An oval masterpiece you'll enjoy.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Enjoy guest artist Dana Jester and his dark soft forest; discover the brilliance of the sun's glow bouncing off a quiet stream and majestic oaks.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Experience the serenity and silence of a fresh undisturbed snowfall with Bob Ross when he takes you to a lovely cabin deep in northern country.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross travels with his paint brushes into the density of an evening grove and discovers the beauty of a gentle, hushed rippling river.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Take a stroll into the woods with Bob Ross and experience the reflections of a jeweled sun bursting into the soft, vibrant day.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross teams up with Mother Nature and paints an incredibly awesome sky hovering over fantastic, snow-covered mountains and glass-like reflections.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Join Captain Danny Allen and Dan Benson from Power-Pole as they embark on an exciting fishing expedition in Cortez, Florida, in the latest installment of Beyond The Surface TV. Witness their relentless pursuit of fish as they adapt to the ever-changing conditions. Don't make the mistake of skipping this captivating episode – it's bound to leave you hooked!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The DCD crew spends a day on the water fishing in an effort to complete the trifecta of a meat haul. Blake shows us where he spent much of his childhood and we get a glimpse of mother natures impact on community.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks returns to Texas for his annual Axis deer hunt with Texas Trophy Whitetails. But this time he brought a friend down for his first chance at an extremely wide Axis buck.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Steve Csizmar having not notched a tag for three seasons has a GIANT Boone and Crockett class typical in his sights this year.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve bounce around the reefs out of Hawks Cay catching a wide variety of reef dwellers.

programme.title: Into the Blue

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve make a big run from Plantation Boat Mart in the Invincible 36’into the green Gulf waters to fill the Yeti cooler and battle with some seas monsters.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: A day of reef fishing in Islamorada turns into a Kingfish and Yellowtail frenzy for Captains Scott and Steve.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: It only takes 3 fish to fill the Yeti cooler when Capt Scott fishes the top with kites for Wahoo and Steve pulls a big Mutton Snapper off the bottom.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve take a long run into the Gulf from Stock Island and load thecoolers with Cobia and huge Yellowtail Snapper.

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: With a free day before Icast. Trenton and Ryan go offshore to try and fill the cooler. Catching a variety of species and hoping to get their hands on a hogfish.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with “Mr Crappie” Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: For DIRT’s first trip across the pond, host Josh Rosen dove head first into Ireland. From long-held traditions to the modern-day artisanal movement, he unearthed the multicultural goldmine between the highlands and the Wild Atlantic Way—with stops for surfing, a seaweed bath, and a couple holes of golf spectated by free-range goats, of course. Foraged cocktails? Fresh crabs from Galway Bay? It’s all on the table in this episode rooted in community, homegrown ingredients, and the damn good people who bring it all together. Subscribe to our YouTube channel to catch up on all of DIRT’s past adventures.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Brandon "Eazy" Thompson is more than our local barber, he's an avid angler, hunter, and dedicated outdoorsman. He'd never fly-fished.....we decided to change that. #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: When we first got the word that a panga was the boat we wanted, we searched online and found what looked like the perfect prospect. Al and Marg drove down to south Florida and met the owner – a young guy who had had big plans for his first boat but had been hit hard by Covid and needed the cash. When they drove up to the Bajío office with it in tow, everyone was stoked. Our first thought was, “wow, this thing is perfect. It’s ready to go!” It’s pretty basic, but that’s what pangas are. All we need is a bamboo pole and we’re good. When Jay showed up, he started making a list of a few things that we might need to add. A casting platform was kind of mandatory. A poling platform would be needed as well. A floor and a couple seats would make the ride easier on everybody. Some rod holders. A cooler. GPS. Lights…The list started growing. All of sudden, our little basic panga was in need some fairly big upgrades.Jay thought it would be helpful to find a local boat builder that would let us do the work in their facility. His thinking was that we could make a trade. They give us space, teach us how to do boat building, let us use their tools and all of the materials. In return…well, we didn’t have a lot to offer. Some free shades? The pleasure of Jay’s company? Some love in the film we were making?We made some calls. No takers. More calls. Still no takers.Then one day, the local Chamber of Commerce decided to through us a welcome party. Super nice of them. We had a big crowd of local business owners show up. One was a woman named Sarah Dougherty. She and her husband own Dougherty Boatworks and Sōlace Boats. “Whatever we can do help, just let us know.” Bingo! “Would you guys like to be in a film?” What an amazing stroke of luck. Steven Dougherty is a legendary boat builder. He’s the guy other boat builders come to when they need advice. And he would be helping us build our panga! Sweet! Check it out…#fishingwithjay

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: One of the most iconic rivers in the world, the Nile has been fished for thousands of years, but in recent decades fishing has nearly halted in many areas due to plastic clogging the river. VeryNile launched the Reviving Cairo Fishermen project, which empowers local fishermen and women to clean the Nile, removing almost 40 tons of plastic per year. The plastic they collect is then turned into sellable products, completing a circular economy that benefits the entire community.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: At age seven, Cash “The Conservation Kid” Daniels began leading cleanups along the Tennessee River in his hometown, Chattanooga. Six years later, Cash continues to make a significant impact on the river’s health by strategically collecting fishing waste and inspiring his peers across the world to protect the environment and all the wildlife he holds dear.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: In this episode of Local Lines Captain Brandon Branch had the opportunity tofinally go fish Yankeetown Florida like never before with Captain Trey Mikell. As time has gone by Trey is establishing himself as one of the best guides in that area and he definitely didn’t disappoint on this trip

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: John and a group of friends make an annual winter trip to catch smallmouth in the dead of KY wintertime on Dale Hollow Lake. Dale Hollow holds the world record smallmouth catch. Nick and Mark Stowe joined the group a few years back but the fishing was a bit tough. Nick and Mark joining again for this episode to try and catch some smallmouth on the famous "Floating Fly Technique".

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Lifelong cowboy and Oklahoma native Bill Parker is believed to be the 1st man to reach the shores of Normandy on D-day…June 6th 1944.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: With a free day before Icast. Trenton and Ryan go offshore to try and fill the cooler. Catching a variety of species and hoping to get their hands on a hogfish.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: The second event day in Cornwall, Ontario takes place on Lake St. Francis where big rains have things stirred up for the teams.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara use Northland's new Pitchin’ Puppet for summer time Walleyes!

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Folks at home, folks at home!We’re back with another Dirty 30 — and this one takes us to the legendary Lake Hartwell, where things didn’t exactly go as planned…This stop on the Bassmaster Elite Series pushed me to my limit. From unpredictable conditions to tough decisions and pressured fish, this one had everything. But that’s what this series is all about — showing you the real highs and lows of professional bass fishing.This is what it’s really like to be a professional bass fisherman…Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you — the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you.I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!!— Ike

programme.title: Destination Dive

programme.title: Ship Shape TV

programme.title: Beyond The Surface

From wildlife encounters to thrilling fishing expeditions, witness the beauty and excitement of this serene locale on Beyond the Surface TV. Don't miss this unforgettable journey through the hidden treasures of one of Florida's most picturesque destinations.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Brandon "Eazy" Thompson is more than our local barber, he's an avid angler, hunter, and dedicated outdoorsman. He'd never fly-fished.....we decided to change that. #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: When we first got the word that a panga was the boat we wanted, we searched online and found what looked like the perfect prospect. Al and Marg drove down to south Florida and met the owner – a young guy who had had big plans for his first boat but had been hit hard by Covid and needed the cash. When they drove up to the Bajío office with it in tow, everyone was stoked. Our first thought was, “wow, this thing is perfect. It’s ready to go!” It’s pretty basic, but that’s what pangas are. All we need is a bamboo pole and we’re good. When Jay showed up, he started making a list of a few things that we might need to add. A casting platform was kind of mandatory. A poling platform would be needed as well. A floor and a couple seats would make the ride easier on everybody. Some rod holders. A cooler. GPS. Lights…The list started growing. All of sudden, our little basic panga was in need some fairly big upgrades.Jay thought it would be helpful to find a local boat builder that would let us do the work in their facility. His thinking was that we could make a trade. They give us space, teach us how to do boat building, let us use their tools and all of the materials. In return…well, we didn’t have a lot to offer. Some free shades? The pleasure of Jay’s company? Some love in the film we were making?We made some calls. No takers. More calls. Still no takers.Then one day, the local Chamber of Commerce decided to through us a welcome party. Super nice of them. We had a big crowd of local business owners show up. One was a woman named Sarah Dougherty. She and her husband own Dougherty Boatworks and Sōlace Boats. “Whatever we can do help, just let us know.” Bingo! “Would you guys like to be in a film?” What an amazing stroke of luck. Steven Dougherty is a legendary boat builder. He’s the guy other boat builders come to when they need advice. And he would be helping us build our panga! Sweet! Check it out…#fishingwithjay

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: One of the most iconic rivers in the world, the Nile has been fished for thousands of years, but in recent decades fishing has nearly halted in many areas due to plastic clogging the river. VeryNile launched the Reviving Cairo Fishermen project, which empowers local fishermen and women to clean the Nile, removing almost 40 tons of plastic per year. The plastic they collect is then turned into sellable products, completing a circular economy that benefits the entire community.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: At age seven, Cash “The Conservation Kid” Daniels began leading cleanups along the Tennessee River in his hometown, Chattanooga. Six years later, Cash continues to make a significant impact on the river’s health by strategically collecting fishing waste and inspiring his peers across the world to protect the environment and all the wildlife he holds dear.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: In this episode of Local Lines Captain Brandon Branch had the opportunity tofinally go fish Yankeetown Florida like never before with Captain Trey Mikell. As time has gone by Trey is establishing himself as one of the best guides in that area and he definitely didn’t disappoint on this trip

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: John and a group of friends make an annual winter trip to catch smallmouth in the dead of KY wintertime on Dale Hollow Lake. Dale Hollow holds the world record smallmouth catch. Nick and Mark Stowe joined the group a few years back but the fishing was a bit tough. Nick and Mark joining again for this episode to try and catch some smallmouth on the famous "Floating Fly Technique".

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Folks at home, folks at home!We’re back with another Dirty 30 — and this one takes us to the legendary Lake Hartwell, where things didn’t exactly go as planned…This stop on the Bassmaster Elite Series pushed me to my limit. From unpredictable conditions to tough decisions and pressured fish, this one had everything. But that’s what this series is all about — showing you the real highs and lows of professional bass fishing.This is what it’s really like to be a professional bass fisherman…Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you — the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you.I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!!— Ike

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of Team Winchester shooters Zach Kienbaum and Desirae Edmunds is told. Zach and Desi discuss how they got started in the shooting sports and how important coaching has become to both of them. They also talk shooting tips. Theo Ribbs breaks down the shotgun sports while Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Paul Sawyer, Nikki Boxler and Gabe Adair have a friendly sporting clays competition.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90’s, Arden doesn’t let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Winchester introduces the Shoot United brand aimed at offering useful information and tips to the millions of new shooters entering the shooting sports. New York native and Midland University competitive shotgun shooter Amy Cawley and her journey as a student-athlete is followed. Also: Theo Ribbs gives shooting tips for competition and Foster Bartholow reviews Winchester AA Diamond Grade.

programme.desc: In a near-future America when everyone is under surveillance, an undercover cop must ingest a ubiquitous drug that thrusts him into a paranoid stupor.

programme.title: Cannonball Run II
programme.desc: The usual suspects return for a new breakneck, ocean-to-ocean free for all!

programme.title: 8 Seconds

programme.title: Alien Autopsy
programme.desc: Two friends make a fake film that they claim is real footage of an autopsy conducted on an extraterrestrial.

programme.title: Osmosis Jones
programme.desc: Inside the body of a zoo worker, a white-blood-cell cop and a cold tablet join forces to stop a virulent virus that’s intent on taking over The City.

programme.title: Suburban Commando
programme.desc: Forced to take a vacation in a quiet American suburb, an intergalactic warrior must protect his new human friends when bounty hunters track him down.

programme.title: Surf Ninjas
programme.desc: Two surfer dudes discover they are princes of a small South Pacific island and are destined to save their native land from a cruel despot.

programme.title: One Crazy Summer
programme.desc: During a summer in Nantucket, a recent high school grad with dreams of being a cartoonist helps a young singer save her family home from developers.

programme.title: Caddyshack II
programme.desc: The snobs of Bushwood Country Club don't know who they're messing with.

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace
programme.desc: A brutal LAPD cop, who is a domineering single dad and neighborhood hawk, makes the lives of a new couple a living hell when they move in next door.

programme.title: U-Turn
programme.desc: A criminal looking to pay off his debts meets a couple in Arizona who hope to use him to settle their personal vendettas, even if it involves murder.

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: Released from prison, Gloria finds herself the reluctant guardian of a young boy who has become the target of a ruthless multinational conglomerate.

programme.title: Faith of My Fathers
programme.desc: This adaptation of John McCain's best-selling autobiography chronicles his experiences as a Navy pilot and five years as a POW in North Vietnam.

programme.title: Every Time We Say Goodbye
programme.desc: When an American pilot meets a serene Jewish girl of Spanish descent during World War II, their diverse backgrounds might mean love could never work.

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: A young ad executive facing terminal cancer and expecting a child records his life's journey, confronting his past for his unborn child's future.

programme.title: Miracle on the Mountain: The Kincaid Family Story
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this film recounts a family's struggle for survival after their private plane crashes on their way to a cabin in the mountains.

programme.title: Ice Castles
programme.desc: This remake of the 1979 film finds Alexis on the cusp of figure skating stardom when an accident on the ice takes her sight, but not her courage.

programme.title: Blue-Eyed Butcher
programme.desc: Based on the shocking true story about a beautiful young wife and mother accused of the brutal murder of her seemingly perfect husband.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew in WWII must contend with thirsty Nazi troops while crossing the Sahara in search of a fabled water well.

programme.title: Quicksilver
programme.desc: Losing his shirt after a bad day on the market, a stock trader makes ends meet as a bicycle courier and uncovers sinister web of intrigue and murder.

programme.title: Lone Star State of Mind
programme.desc: Pressed for time before leaving Texas with his girlfriend, a mechanic must deal with the repercussions of his simple cousin’s latest bungled crime.

programme.title: Lords of Dogtown
programme.desc: The true-life story of three teenage surfers and best friends who radicalized the sport of skateboarding in Venice, California during the 1970s.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Maximum Risk
programme.desc: A police officer and his twin brother's fiancée team up to expose an international conspiracy in this erotic, globe-hopping adventure.

programme.title: Company of Heroes
programme.desc: Set during World War II, Company of Heroes, follows US military units during the Battle of Normandy and the Allied liberation of France.

programme.title: Blue Thunder
programme.desc: Classic ‘80s action film about a police pilot who learns that the futuristic helicopter he’s testing could cause hellish destruction on U.S. citizens.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Dreaming of being a famous R&B guitarist, a young virtuoso seeks out a legendary musician and must convince him to teach him the ways of the blues.

programme.title: Punchline
programme.desc: Steve, a broke stand-up comedian, develops a friendship and mentorship with Lilah, a homemaker with an ambition to be a stand-up comedian.

programme.title: Murphy's Romance
programme.desc: After moving to small-town Arizona and falling for an older widowed pharmacist, a divorcée with a 12-year old son gets an unwanted visit from her ex.

programme.title: Places in the Heart
programme.desc: This stirring drama follows a widow as she struggles to raise her two children and save her Texas farm during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
programme.desc: During World War II, feuding leaders train British recruits for a risky covert mission to blow up a giant battleship in an enemy-held French port.

programme.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
programme.desc: A small stockholder-turned-corporate heroine ousts a crooked Board of Trustees and reinstates an honest director, falling in love along the way.

programme.title: Pushover
programme.desc: To get the lowdown on stolen cash, a duty-bound cop makes a move on the girlfriend of a murderous bank robber and accidentally falls for her.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Phffft!
programme.desc: A divorced couple hopes to move on after their split, but fate has other plans. They’re dating other people, but they keep running into each other!

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: It Happened to Jane
programme.desc: When a shipment of expired shellfish arrives to her New England lobstery, Jane Osgood decides to take a capitalist railroad tycoon to court.

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone
programme.desc: Based on the book by Alistair MacLean.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: A cold, perfectionist wife will stop at nothing to have her house and life run as she wishes, even if it means controlling her husband's every move.

programme.title: You Can't Run Away From It
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress teams up with an enterprising reporter to escape her domineering father's plan of keeping her from getting married.

programme.title: She Played With Fire
programme.desc: An English insurance man (Jack Hawkins) discovers his ex-girlfriend (Arlene Dahl) and her husband's (Dennis Price) art-forgery/arson scam.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: It's up to secret agent Matt Helm to save the day when a megalomaniac and his dastardly organization plot to sabotage America's atomic missile system.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: The Pathfinder
programme.desc: Based on the novel of the same name, a scout is sent by the British to infiltrate a French stronghold near the Great Lakes in the 1750s.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Beyond the Sacramento
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) and Cannonball (Dub Taylor) save Lodestone from swindlers preparing a bond scam.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: Smoky Canyon
programme.desc: The masked Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) settles a feud between cattlemen and sheepmen.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: To settle an old score, a father and his sons rob a cattle-swindling rancher, go into hiding, and soon find a posse of townsfolk after them.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: Hollywood Round-Up
programme.desc: Kindly, fading star Carol Stevens (Helen Twelvetrees) accepts a role in a two-bit Western movie and arrives for an on-location shoot in a small town. When Stevens has words with her pompous co-star, Grant Drexel (Grant Withers), Drexel's stuntman, Buck Kennedy (Buck Jones), steps in to defend her. Kennedy's honorable gesture costs him his job. After a group of gangsters posing as a film crew frames the newly unemployed Kennedy for the robbery of a local bank, he must struggle to clear his name.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Blackjack Ketchum, Desperado
